qas.question: What was he also known as?
Who opened his cause for canonization?
When was Pope John XXIII considered "blessed?"
Who was the last pope before John XXIII to receive the title?
When was Pope John Paul II declared "Blessed"?
What was Pope John Paul II also known as?

plausible_answers.text: to the altar of St. Jerome

qas.question: Where was Pope John Paul II taken after his beatification?
Who opened the cause for canonization for Pope John Paul II?

plausible_answers.text: during the final session of the Second Vatican Council

qas.question: During what event was the cause for canonization opened for Pope John Paul II?

context: He was known affectionately as <b6_0>"<a0_0>Good Pope John<a0_0/>"<b6_0/>. His cause for canonization was opened under <a1_0><b8_0>Pope Paul VI<b8_0/><a1_0/> <b9_0>during the final session of the Second Vatican Council<b9_0/> on 18 November 1965, along with the cause of Pope Pius XII. <b5_0>On <a2_0>3 September 2000<b5_0/><a2_0/>, John XXIII was declared "Blessed" alongside Pope Pius IX by <a3_0>Pope John Paul II<a3_0/>, the penultimate step on the road to sainthood after a miracle of curing an ill woman was discovered. He was the first pope since <a4_0>Pope Pius X<a4_0/> to receive this honour. Following his beatification, his body was moved from its original burial place in the grottoes below the Vatican <b7_0>to the altar of St. Jerome<b7_0/> and displayed for the veneration of the faithful.[citation needed]
